intro: Bosqueia spinosa, commonly known as the spiny bosqueia, is a shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and dense, spiny foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by small, red berries. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Bosqueia spinosa is often used in ornamental gardening due to its unique appearance and hardy nature.
